meanings.definition: To chew or gnaw at something persistently
meanings.sent1: The little puppy would begnaw on his favorite toy all day long.
meanings.sent2: The beaver would begnaw on the wood to build its dam.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel would begnaw on the acorn, thinking it was a tiny nut.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to begnaw at the old wooden fence, slowly breaking it down.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar would begnaw on the leaf, leaving tiny bite marks behind.

meanings.definition: To wear away or erode gradually by gnawing
meanings.sent1: The constant dripping water would begnaw at the rock, creating a small hole.
meanings.sent2: The river would begnaw at the riverbank, changing its shape over time.
meanings.sent3: The wind would begnaw at the sandcastle, slowly destroying its towers.
meanings.sent4: The rust would begnaw at the metal fence, causing it to weaken.
meanings.sent5: The waves would begnaw at the cliff, shaping it into a rugged coastline.

meanings.sent1: The mosquito would begnaw at my arm, making me itch all night.
meanings.sent2: The little brother would begnaw at his sister, asking endless questions.
meanings.sent3: The persistent salesperson would begnaw at the customer, trying to make a sale.
meanings.sent4: The constant noise would begnaw at my patience, making me irritable.
meanings.sent5: The dripping faucet would begnaw at my sanity, keeping me awake at night.
